meanings.definition: Smaller or weaker than others of the same kind
meanings.sent1: The runty puppy struggled to keep up with its siblings.
meanings.sent2: The runty apple was easily overlooked among the larger, shinier ones.
meanings.sent3: The runty kitten tried to meow loudly like the big cats but only managed a squeak.
meanings.sent4: The runty flower in the garden wilted under the weight of the raindrops.
meanings.sent5: The runty bird's wings were too small to lift it off the ground.

meanings.sent1: The runty car in the showroom had dents and scratches all over.
meanings.sent2: The runty house on the street had peeling paint and a crooked roof.
meanings.sent3: The runty sandwich at the deli was missing half of its fillings.
meanings.sent4: The runty tree in the forest bore only a few withered fruits.
meanings.sent5: The runty boat in the harbor leaked water from multiple holes.

meanings.sent1: The runty plant in the pot barely reached the top edge.
meanings.sent2: The runty child looked much younger than their actual age due to being stunted.
meanings.sent3: The runty tree in the backyard seemed to be in a perpetual state of being a sapling.
meanings.sent4: The runty stream trickled slowly, unable to grow into a rushing river.
meanings.sent5: The runty mountain peak was barely visible above the clouds.
